metadata.title: CVE-2024-35837 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: net:mvpp2: clear BM pool before initialization Register value persist afterbooting the kernel using kexec which results in kernel panic. Thus clearthe BM pool registers before initialisation to fix the issue.

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
linux-aws package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
linux-azure package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
